scheme_name: To Increase Fish Seed Production and Inland Fisheries Equipment in Tribal Areas
details: This scheme aims to enhance fish production and provide employment opportunities to Scheduled Tribes (ST) individuals engaged in inland fisheries.

benefits.standard_of_assistance: ₹90/- per 1000 spawn to fry (30% recovery); ₹260/- per 1000 fry to fingerlings (35% recovery); ₹460/- per 1000 spawn to fingerlings (12% recovery)
100% assistance for fish seed and transportation cost
100% assistance for prawn seed and transportation cost for Scheduled Caste lessees
50% assistance for Tin Boat & Net (₹15,000/- or ₹7,500/-, whichever is less); 50% assistance for F.R.P Boat & Net (₹30,000/- or ₹15,000/-, whichever is less)
60% assistance for Scheduled Tribe beneficiaries Unit cost: ₹3,00,000/-, subsidy: ₹1,80,000/- or 60% of actual cost, whichever is lower
₹1,250/- stipend after 10-day training; ₹125/- per day during training
A kit worth ₹2,500/- given after completing 3-month training

eligibility: Individuals/ societies/ self-help groups/ associations/ reservoir monopolies/ private units etc. involved in inland fisheries activities can avail the benefits of inland schemes.
The applicant should be a Fisherman.
The applicant should belong to the Schedule Tribe(ST) category.
Applicant should be above 18 years of age.
The beneficiary fisherman must have his own bank account.
application_process: On the home page, click on ‘Schemes’ and then click on ‘Agricultural Schemes’.
Now select the scheme, click on the ‘Apply’ button and an application page will open.
Click on "Apply New" button and submit a new application.
Click on the "Update Application" button to add corrections to the application.
Once the application is done, confirm it.
Take a print out of the confirmed application.
